basics.name: Mahie Crabbe
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

courses: ICS 241: Discrete Math II for CS
ICS 141: Discrete Math I for CS

work.summary: Working in the front of house as a cashier and working in the back of house as a barista making smoothies, juices, and acai bowls
highlights: Fulfill hygenic practices when handelling food items

volunteer.summary: As a member I actively help with temple services, participate in neighborhood clean-ups, and volunteer in several positions at the Lantern FLoating Hawaii
highlights: Helps guests at Lantern Floating Hawaii
Help educate and integrate Hawaiian culture and perspective

volunteer.summary: As a member I attend weekly PANDA meetings and collaborate with fellow classmates to solve mock interview problems

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship is an automatic $2,000 scholarship per year for four years of undergraduate study for first-time degree seeking students. Students must have a 3.5 GPA, 1200 SAT or 23 ACT upon the time of application to UH Manoa.

awards.title: UMH Second Century Scholarship
awards.summary: The scholarship is available to Native Hawaiian students with demonstrated financial need pursuing both graduate and undergraduate credit work in any field of study on all 10 campuses of the University of Hawai'i System.

awards.title: Manoa Opportunity Grant
awards.summary: Mānoa Opportunity Grant is available to students who demonstrate financial need based on information provided on your FAFSA. Due to limited funding, the maximum annual UHM award is $4,000 and is dependent upon tuition charged and enrollment status. For undergraduates, this grant is for first time Bachelor's degree seekers. You must be enrolled at least half-time in UH Mānoa courses (6 credits as an undergraduate or 4 credits as a graduate student) to receive the Mānoa Opportunity Grant. Graduate students enrolled in a 1 credit full-time course will not be considered for this grant. The grant will be prorated based upon your enrollment in UH Mānoa courses when not at full time.

awards.title: Nā Hoʻokama
awards.summary: A scholarship to nurture the dreams of Native Hawaiian learners to grow as ‘ōiwi leaders. NHAP is available to undergraduate and graduate students who demonstrate financial need. There are no additional eligibility requirements to be considered eligible for application review.
